description: Smallest positive even integer that is an unordered sum of two primes in exactly n ways.
comments: Except for first two terms, same as A001172.The first occurrence of k in A045917.The graph looks like a comet. - _Daniel Forgues_, Jun 12 2014
links: T. D. Noe and Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (first 1001 terms from T. D. Noe)
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
mathematica: f[n_] := Length@ Select[2n - Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ n, PrimeQ]; nn = 100; t = Table[0, {nn}]; k = 1; cnt = 0; While[cnt < nn, a = f@k; If[a <= nn && t[[a]] == 0, t[[a]] = 2 k; cnt++]; k++]; t (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
author: _David W. Wilson_, Jun 14 1998
